author.organization: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), Lincoln Laboratory

abstract.t: On Friday, 8 May 1970, at 9:30 AM a meeting at M.I.T. Lincoln Laboratory is proposed. A description of LIL (Local Interaction Language) for the TSP (Terminal Support Processor) system will be presented.

The purpose of the TSP system is to provide a flexible I/O capability for network users. In order to achieve maximum flexibility, the system is user-programmable in an interpretable language called LIL.
